nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a13cb908-e698-4c73-bc4e-dd3063d2c094) for commit f3cde93df9201e0be36c554c9c2834b76e756626.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ffd0010d-23d4-46a7-b3d5-9a8abe93aa32/to/a13cb908-e698-4c73-bc4e-dd3063d2c094) against commit e59662d190974bd13c9649c0f62ae79730c0af77:
```diff
  Benchmark   Metric         Change
  =================================
+ lint        instructions   -15.1%
+ lint        wall-clock     -15.7%
```

Two files got faster by at least 10⁹ instructions (and none got slower by that amount):
```text
Files that got faster:
  Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sums.Associator:              -2.6996 * 10⁹ (-9.97%)
  Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sums.Basic:                   -1.5400 * 10⁹ (-5.13%)
```

I have restored the old lemma (without the simp attribute) and changed the name of the new one. LGTM, thanks!
bors d+

:v: semorrison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9224077079/job/25378636346)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9224077079/job/25378636634)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9224077079/job/25378635932)
This one makes me sad. Can it at least be `norm_cast`?
Is there somewhere this would be helpful?

I'm confused why you would be sad about this, unless you have particular knowledge of it being needed as a simp lemma in a downstream project.

I guess I will just add back `norm_cast` to avoid this PR getting blocked up on this. I want this in asap, as it makes life drastically better when working in files with `import Mathlib`.

To be clear, here is the type:
```
theorem MeasureTheory.ProbabilityMeasure.coeFn_comp_toFiniteMeasure_eq_coeFn.{u_1} : ∀ {Ω : Type u_1}
  [inst : MeasurableSpace Ω] (ν : ProbabilityMeasure Ω),
  (fun s ↦ (↑ν.toFiniteMeasure s).toNNReal) = fun s ↦ (↑ν s).toNNReal :=
fun {Ω} [MeasurableSpace Ω] ν ↦ rfl
```
i.e. both LHS and RHS are a lambda, meaning that the DiscrTree can't doing anything with it and it is applied everywhere. I don't think I want it in norm_cast either.

I am not sure I understand why this is a bad simp lemma, can you elaborate a little bit (maybe adding a comment explaining why it is bad just before the lemma)? (I mean, why wouldn't it only try to apply it to `ProbabilityMeasure`s?)

As a replacement, can we have `ν.toFiniteMeasure s = ν s` for a given set `s`, as a simp lemma, or will it have the same issue?
Is this a sign that the `Coe` instance should be defined differently?

@sgouezel I've added a comment. That replacement works fine, so I've changed it.

If you'd like to change the name to reflect the change in statement, please either push directly to the PR, or lets do it in a followup.
@Ruben-VandeVelde, I haven't worked out what we could replace the `Coe` instance with.
Couldn't the DiscrTree index the type in the lambdas (here NNReal), which means it wouldn't be tried always? Anyway, this is off topic for this PR.
The current DiscrTree doesn't do this. Jovan has an alternative DiscrTree that does, but it is unlikely to land in Lean anytime soon.
Thanks for update, @sgouezel. Looks good to me now!
I agree with Ruben's diagnosis. Watch out for a PR in a few minutes
I've opened #13171

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove bad simps, and add test
